slides.title: Our vision is to break down the walls between technical experts, AI systems, and physical automation to accelerate biology and medicine across all scales.
Today's labs are rich in data but poor in comprehension because of data and system silos.
We believe that the cambrian moment is coming through human-AI co-evolution.
We are Gradient, and our philosophy is: "data trains, vision teaches." We are a human-centric company accelerating the next generation of collaborative tools.
Here is the team that can make this happen.
This team has laid a solid foundation for our vision, and we are now at an inflection point with our first product to benefit scientists.
Our first product, LabOS, equips AI with its "eyes and hands," kicking off co-evolution in the domain of biotech.
Demo: AI with eyes and hands
What you see is not purely human-AI collaboration; in the process, we are building a world model for biotechnology and clinical use cases.
We have already gotten a lot interest from pharma about how Lab-OS can create value and in we are in active partnership discussions.
This solution can also be used in a clinical settings and we are engaged setting up a pilot with Stanford teaching hospital.
There is a huge market potential in creating operational efficiency and reducing errors in pharma and pathology; that is our starting point and low hanging fruit.
In the near term, we are creating a subscription and partnership model to gain customers and to create a dataset.
In the long-term, our objective is to leverage our vision datasets of high-value tasks and world model which facilitates humans and robots to execute and train a wide variety of high-value tasks.
We are fundraising for $30m and this will enable the key milestone of commercialization.
